result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaylen D Handy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 6 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
-Complete 20 hours of community service.

*Court grants expunction if defendant successfully completes probation, has no new arrests rising to the level of probable cause, and all fines are paid in full.  

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Jaylen D Handy in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Jaylen D Handy in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case set for plea & sentencing at request of defense.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bond continued as previously set. Signature Bond was signed at the County Jail paperwork is not in the file at this time.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jaylen D Handy in court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23  for a Pretrial Conference.
AS OF 9-14-2015, CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO BRANCH 45, JUDGE HAVAS.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jaylen D Handy
Current: N85W14030 Fond Du Lac Ave, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051   (Effective: 09-03-2015)
Prior: 11522 West Orchard Court, West Allis, WI 53214
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 09-03-2015 at 01:30pm
